Package UI.Controllers

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • UI.Controllers.Controller
  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller for the main inventory control form.
    Author:
    David Brungardt

    • Method Detail

      • handleAddParts

        public void handleAddParts()
        Handles adding parts to the inventory. Opens the add part form and adds parts to the part table. I think a compatible feature that would be suitable for this application would be to add some kind of database so the data is persistent. I was honestly a little disappointed that I wasn't going to be connecting to any kind of SQL or NOSQL database to store these inventory objects. I don't think it would be very difficult to implement this, you could just add some CRUD methods to handle the data in the database and make calls to those methods when you are updating the tables.

      • handleModifyParts

        public void handleModifyParts()
        Handles modifying parts in the inventory. Opens the modify part form, and loads the selected part.

      • handleDeleteParts

        public void handleDeleteParts()
        Handles deleting parts from the inventory and removing parts from the part table. Asks for confirmation before removing part.

      • handleSearchParts

        public void handleSearchParts()
        Searches for parts in the part table and selects part(s) if found.

      • updateParts

        public void updateParts()
        Updates parts in the part table and removes row selection. The bug that I spent the most time tracking down in this entire application is contained inside of this method. Originally when I was trying to clear the table row selection, I made the call "partTable.getSelectionModel().select(null);", what was probably the most confusing about this is the fact that it worked in some instances; however, I would later discover that this was not a reliable way to clear the selected table rows and often it wouldn't work. Once I replaced that call with "partTable.getSelectionModel().clearSelection();" things went much more smoothly.

      • getPartToModify

        public Part getPartToModify()
        This method gets the selected part from the table on the form.
        Returns:
        Selected part in part table (if any).

      • handleAddProducts

        public void handleAddProducts()
        Handles adding products to the inventory. Opens the add product form and adds products to the product table.

      • handleModifyProducts

        public void handleModifyProducts()
        Handles modifying products in the inventory. Opens the modify product form, and loads the selected part.

      • handleDeleteProducts

        public void handleDeleteProducts()
        Handles deleting products from the inventory and removing products from the product table. Asks for confirmation before deleting the product.

      • handleSearchProducts

        public void handleSearchProducts()
        Searches for products in the product table and selects product(s) if found.

      • updateProducts

        public void updateProducts()
        Updates products in the product table and removes row selection.

      • getProductToModify

        public Product getProductToModify()
        This method gets the selected product from the table on the form.
        Returns:
        Selected product in product table (if any).
